9S6ogfYrIJ_fBbtwQIoXfw.text: Love the food and friendly environment! The Ethiopian coffee is something definitely worth for a try. Will recommend.

wPABbBgl-EHCn2fwgLVwWQ.text: Absolutely a wonderful find.  It was my girlfriend and my first Ethiopian experience.  The food was very flavorful and fun to sample the vegetable platter and eat with our hands.  The waiter and waitress we so attentive and were genuinely vested in our enjoyment of the experience.  Very kind and wonderful people.    The dining area was pretty busy including couples, locals, Ethiopians and even families (we were impressed seeing the younger kids be so adventurous and genuinely loving it).  This is a must try!!

cdrpEw28Z3VQWjxbJZ9b4g.text: This is the highest rated of the many Ethiopian foods in Charlotte and I can see why.  Wifey and I took the Mother out to finally try This delicious cuisine and we weren't disappointed.  They shared the vegetarian feast full of various vegetable and lentil items on a bed of injeera with extra on the side.  I did the doro wat with some fresh Ethiopian cheese on the side, which was just fantastic. If you know what paneer is, it's basically a crumbled version.  I had to drop one star as they ran out of Ethiopian coffee but we would go back to re-try any time.  The service was great and they really wanted to make sure we enjoyed everything. You can tell they really care about what the put out in front of their customers. That's why it was packed even at 8:30 at night. The Mother was very impressed

5KT9fICk5VGxtRGzx2v-1A.text: My wife wanted to try this restuarant and we went tonight the service and food was really good. We would definitely come back.

KiMBbR7_zv7HEU2Utgxvbw.text: First Yelp review because the food was amazing!!! Can't wait to come back! Had the feast and let me tell you, DID NOT DISAPPOINT. Wish I could give it 10 stars!!! Thanks Abugida!!

ny2kKXHjvfUYwnYMCGai4A.text: Want an 'outside the box' experience?  You'll find one here.  Wife and I always like to try new things and even though she'd eaten Ethiopian style food before I had not and therefore we ventured to this new place for a change from the norm.  While you will not find any trendy seating or decor, what I can confirm is that you will find some of the best and freshest ingredients and food I've eaten in a while.  The service, like others have mentioned, was super pleasant and very eager to explain and answer questions we might have had.  Don't come here expecting some sexy, romantic or upscale atmosphere.  Come here to eat clean, fresh and incredible cultural cuisine.  You won't be disappointed.

CN8pI2t5nqP20fra_MVfWQ.text: Ethiopian food is my favorite and this place does not disappoint!  The staff are so friendly and the dishes are tasty!  I recommend the feast options.

B9q2E43MzQ1EVfoa0YFgLg.text: Definitely the best Ethiopian restaurant I've been in town. Food was home made and delicious! Service was second to none-making you feel like home! The Ethiopian hot tea and Ethiopian coffee are both wonderful. Entree wise, I like ZelZel Wet the most, but almost everything on the menu is good! Explore and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Tips (bottom) + ZelZelWet (both left and right)
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Derek Beef Tips (two orders)

Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. ZelZel Wet + Dora Wet in the middle; Derek Beef Tips (Up and Down); Kitfo left and right; Ethiopian tea and Ethiopian coffee

eQhU2w0j5q95lW_su-8I-A.text: We went here for lunch ; had the Abugida feast - good for 2 - we loved it !! Great service - The hostess was warm and welcoming. Tip: try the Ethiopian tea - it had all sorts of goodness in it .

0icwdw9-lt7AEkeMTpoDoQ.text: Love love love this place! Great price, amazing food and a very fun and friendly vibe. I also love the authentic Ethiopian jazz. Needless to say I'll be back again and again and again!

aH5S14RPP7km14GzA1nl9Q.text: Ethiopian food seasoning is similar to Indian food. You can have if mild up to spicy. The vegetable plates are very similar to southern veggi plate. Only difference is the spongy flat bread, call injera. It has a slight sour taste to it. Tibs are meat dishes sauteed with vegetables. Their beef Tibs are very flavorful, it's a combination of spice with a touch of lemon and cinnamon taste. The zilzil wat, is a stew. It was okay. Too much fat for my taste. Ethiopian coffee takes time to make. Be aware it is very strong coffee, but smooth. They have a cappuccino machine if you want the typical coffee.  The owners are very nice and helpful. Definitely will come back.

LsQsgEqSBRZd9O8YPXZANA.text: Great new Ethiopian restaurant on Central!  Beautifully decorated with interesting art inside.  Very warm and inviting.  An old house that was converted to a restaurant. We had the Vegetarian Delight, a very reasonably priced sampler (the red lentils are awesome).  Our friends got the beef tibs and said it was excellent.  Service was attentive.  Very clean and the unisex bathroom (HB2 be gone!!) smelled wonderful.  Check it out y'all!

1stTOQB2xidMjlUACFtMcw.text: Great spot for Ethiopian cuisine!  We tried the combination plate.

VmJTYkjvmhSHeACd1KKpxw.text: This is my favorite Ethiopian restaurant in North Carolina. I'd recommend the shiro,  but make sure to ask about the lamb tibs.

Bd9Qcra6lGIgU6D1mXHdJg.text: This place has a family restaurant feel. It's definitely not your typical American style restaurant. We had the shiro, vegi combo and timatit Fitfit (tomato salad soaked with their flat bread And lemon and sauce) As a vegan I get a trill from discovering new restaurants and Ethiopian food is a vegans best friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shiro and special kitfo

NHo7X4ruB2MI26-yal-iZg.text: This place was delicious !! We got authentic and tasty food with friendly service . This place offers great good without breaking the bank . There was three of us and our order filled all of us up . If you've never tried Ethiopian try it here . We had Kifto and the Abugida Feast w/ chicken . The spices are amazing ! Try this place , check out my pics.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Abugida Feast before the Kifto was added to the mix .
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Abugida Feast with chicken and the Kifto was added to both sides at the table . Amazing !

KXMVittO1JT6dbUUO8mygA.text: Just walking in, the place smells fantastic. Great food. Warm, welcoming atmosphere. First timers try the feast. Great to bring a date.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

T5iv90uq8L2r8TV6vRJokg.text: This place is awesome and about as authentic as it gets. Best coffee we've ever had. The family that runs the place is super nice.

lVbFNdXXVGJ_DRV3f5DpFA.text: I went to dinner here with some friends recently and we all thoroughly enjoyed it. None of us are very familiar with Ethiopian food, but our waitress walked us through every step of the meal which was great!  My friend and I split the vegetarian feast with a side of homemade cottage cheese and our two other friends had meat platters. Everything was incredibly flavorful and the portions were very generous.   The ambiance was relatively minimal but still comfortable and as tables filled up around us it began to feel more cozy. Every staff person was very warm and friendly as well.

ioCd9fATmHNHa8_-NS3FiQ.text: This was a really interesting place to eat. We were looking for something new and different and came across here. We didn't really know what to expect, but they recommended different options and explained what was good. We really liked it, but it was definitely different from anything we were used to. I had the vegetarian platter and I think I enjoyed my plate most out of all of us. I'd recommend this place though!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian platter

vopeCOOQrUanrnYKP7uikQ.text: Abugida is the very definition of a hidden gem: still rough around the edges, ambiance-wise, but who cares? Their food is amazing and the owners and staff are really friendly.  I feel like this is the type of place that will make its reputation on great food, then follow that up by perhaps renovating or moving to improve the "experience" factor. I'm rooting for them 100% and have referred several friends and family there.   A close friend of the family is from Eritrea and has owned and operated a very successful Ethiopian/Eritean restaurant in the northeast. So, we know good Ethiopian food when we see it, and this is very good!

lWlZEGrIHZ0FGcAXiISH_Q.text: The food here is amazing !!! We had the veggie combo and it was to die for and the service is awesome too

uqjpEBsSvrsmP4kv9_-qdw.text: The vegetarian feast is a delicious blend of savory vegetables cooked in the perfect spices. I crave this more than any other for comfort food served by a friendly and kind staff. We are vegan and they asked about using butter while taking our order which was thoughtful touch. I look forward to indulging again soon!

Tiysakxx0yDCBKjqfSYY8g.text: The best Ethiopian FOOD in NC!!!!!!!   My God I truly am addicted to this place thank God the price is very reasonable. I recommend everything but my #1 is Derek Tips (Dry beef Tibs) with Gomen and Aybe (cabbage and home made cottage cheese). Warning  this is super addictive but like I said the price complements my budget.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch (for one)

qrXEcfze3j9RTUZwm9vukA.text: First time eating Ethiopian. Very nice building. Hostess was friendly and made sure you had what you needed. Love hand sanitizer at every table since there are no utensils to eat with. Food was ok. It would have been nice to have thicker, stronger napkins then the thin cocktail ones to clean your hands off with.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

vcguZzH1A5kuC9Z8bmzbRQ.text: After hearing about Abugida Cafe- I had to check it out. I was pleasantly surprised by the entire experience. Not only was our waitress extremely friendly, she was also patient and willing to help walk us through our experience and make recommendations.   We ordered the kitfo, beef tips, and Abugida feast with chicken and it was plenty of food for the four of us.   The Ethiopian bread made for the perfect utensil and I would highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The front is the Abugida feast with chicken in the middle and the back is the beef tibs and kitfo

JOKg7yqLA8s46qonSpnU4Q.text: Never had Ethiopian food before. This was amazing! Would highly recommend it to everyone. Lots of vegetarian options as well as several choices for those who enjoy meats.

s0LM0qBKhDu7spxwwD8wNA.text: This place has great food.  Location and decor is modest though inside is clean and comfortable.  The staff is very nice.  We had the Abugida Feast- perfect for 2!  Try the Ethiopian wine and coffee.  We'll be back!

-VF2YQ4wNSan7hvCJffEUA.text: Authentic and scrumptious Ethiopian. Fabulous lunch buffet with most of the menu on it. Amazing food run by a kind family. If you've never tried Ethiopian it's worth the experience (no silver ware and all)!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch buffet in action.

oAG6hhelRXHDTeDk617Sog.text: The kitfo made here is the best on the east coast!!!  The vegetables are all very greasy and seasoned to perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

s2jXxXSej9d3YHh632gBOA.text: This place is a total hidden gem. Food was amazing, service was so nice, everything about this place is totally charming, and I would return again in a heartbeat. Its a little place inside an old converted yellow house on Central ave - pretty easy to miss - but please do NOT miss it. The food here was so good! I'm from San Francisco and I've had great Ethiopian food there and in New York and DC, but I would not have expected to find equally amazing food out here in Charlotte. So pleasantly surprised! The vegetarian feast was fantastic and filling for 2 people, not to mention super cheap (we paid $22 for 2 people to split the vegetarian feast and one additional side dish). Love this place - will return again, and hope you do too!

7Saee705g27sH9EdxEX-Qw.text: This place is great. Truly a unique and delicious experience. We tried a variety of dishes and they were all fantastic and flavorful. Service was also top notch. Highly recommend!

8IQN6JUh_DJ_3dl5OtbRgA.text: Not surprising that they have all five stars reviews, terrific food, service, everything you would want from an Ethiopian meal. Had the vegetarian feast and added on the only veggie option that wasn't included and it was much more than enough for two people. Make sure to get an Ethiopian coffee if you like super strong java, which I definitely do. Oh, and super cheap, not surprisingly. Our whole meal was $22! We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian FEAST
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

bsYZp4y6FMlW3tJIc5ELSA.text: This was my first experience eating Ethiopian. Had the lunch buffet and tried everything I had room for and some. Couldn't really tell you exactly what any of it was called but there was a beef dish with berebere that I will be back for. The spicy lentils were especially delicious as well. If there are vegetarians or those gluten free'ers in your crew, they won't be disappointed with this place. There are options for everyone.  The staff was awesome and very helpful to us first timers. I think they got a good laugh watching me try to eat with my hands. I think I wore as much as I ate. Both service and food were excellent. Looking forward to trying the dinner menu.

yqz_APgS-tSzJ6tENCSwuA.text: I don't know if this restaurant serves authentic Ethiopian food coz I never traveled to Ethiopia, but it sure does feel like it's authentic. Even if it's not, it's delicious! The restaurant is small and cozy, the staff is very friendly, overall a great environment! Will definitely go back to taste more.

6bEFgToaGElrI6u0FePi2w.text: I was in the mood for something different today, and found this awesome new restaurant! The staff is super friendly and attentive. I ordered the Vegetarian Feast, it was so delicious...especially the lentils. The ambience of this cafe feels very 'old country', which was exactly what I was searching for...authenticity and culture!  *You have to experience this for yourself, so please check them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Vegetarian Feast!

0oxN9cYROrIpaDyrUYzloQ.text: Great food and environment for a nice evening out. Perfect for a blend of meat eaters and vegetarians. The waiter was so pleasant and down to earth too. Order one of the feast options to share for 2 people.  Highly recommend!!

_JU7Mypl1zEEV182qd13yg.text: Abugida is absolutely delicious with humble and excellent service while being reasonably priced. It's my favorite Ethiopian/Eritrean restaurant in Charlotte. I will typically drive 20-25 minutes to eat here. I normally get the ZilZil Wot and Gomen and in my 5 times dining there when I come in for business, it's been great every time.

sv2XUcXCSNOGS3gs7Ya02Q.text: Good food and good service  and great food helped with WiFi and they told us about Ethiopia and how they work and  what they do and in Ethiopia I would love to come here every day

k4B_7TES-aMsW8ArOPMRdA.text: Fantastic spot.  This is one of those restaurants that will be a staple, if it isn't already.   I travel a lot and America has become a stamp over and over.  Same, same, same.   This is different. My experience was that it brings several different cultural experiences together and makes you break social barriers.  Go here with people you don't know well and watch what happens. Flavors are familiar yet new.

Jw_8KGiNS4Q0rElDIqoDog.text: My first time here. The staff is friendly and helpful. The atmosphere is cozy. I forgot the name of the dish I ordered but it was the feast with all the veggies with chicken. The feast is enough to have leftovers. all of the food I ate was good and seasoned well and also hot. I would return to this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

4jQ1j8-Su5S3k8HT14DwRg.text: Excellent, authentic, hole in the wall Ethiopian joint!!!  Went with some Yelp friends and had the Abugida feast (with Beef and Chicken)! A great way to sample a little bit of everything. The flavor of the beef was amazing but those spicy lentils were out of this world.  Very helpful and friendly staff and very reasonable prices.  Great place for a food adventure to get you out of your comfort zone and try something new! I didn't know the names of anything I was eating but it was all good!!!!  Hear they have an awesome coffee ceremony!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

GA-sW4BDC3C1HnOqT326pQ.text: I loved this place.  Just as good as my favorites in the Alexandria/DC area.  The injera was especially good, and they may have my favorite red lentils ever.  (I almost ordered more of them.)  Service was very good.

HdgCj73R4sDnJUz4AfnM-w.text: So glad we tried this, my dad wanted to come here a whole year before we did. It's clean, inexpensive, and authentic. I was impressed with the respect they had towards making sure meat wasn't mixed with vegetarian dishes. Nice to know it's family owned too! So cute

487wkTI60IS_7OSjkjm3kQ.text: Wonderful! I brought someone who had never had Ethiopian food before and I think they ate more than I did. The staff is awesome and the food was just as great! The one thing I was sad about was not having a sweet treat at the end but I highly recommend the coffee to finish your meal!

3ZxLewXRVsQJwM3kg4_Suw.text: Delicious food! Love the vegetarian combo plates. The atmosphere is charming. The staff are very nice and attentive. Will definitely be back.

6Q68afhySQPENCj9KxaPqQ.text: Absolutely excellent Ethiopian food in a cozy, home-like atmosphere. The waitstaff/owners are really charming and genuinely want you to have an amazing experience at their restaurant.   Interior is spotlessly clean and the only thing Abugida is lacking at present is desserts and a liquor license. They're working on the liquor license so soon you'll be able to enjoy a cool glass of honey wine with your food.  Don't miss out on their sampler platter which is a good value and the best way to sample a variety of dishes. They serve a delicious collard greens + house made Ethiopian fresh cheese dish which is very unique; we have never encountered this dish before and we eat Ethiopian food frequently.   All in all Abugida is a great place for people who are addicted to Ethiopian food or people who are trying it for the first time...and everyone in between. It's a gem and a great addition to Charlotte!

smW3ZhgtoZFBPkyo7T7YKw.text: The food is amazing here, the ambiance is great, great place to visit, very authentic.

PAhZGx_aqwfFd3ysCwWr9A.text: Came to Charlotte for a class and ended up for dinner at Abugida. I love Ethiopian food and we have one back in my area. The food here is fresh, flavorful and they give decent portions. My husband and kids loved the food. I do like the food but I think I like Awaze in Cary a tad better over this. But nevertheless if it's your first time trying Ethiopian you will surely love it.

lEGWKG_rIbk7qz8OIEuyJA.text: Great spot! Ordered the beef tips with some veggies and it had great flavor! The staff is super friendly and I will definitely be coming back. Great out of the box dining experience from your traditional Charlotte establishments.

duWTi0De182qpu4L_8hTSg.text: This place is incredible. My husband and I split the vegetarian feast with the added beef tips and it was delicious. The service was equally as impressive as the food. This will definitely be a staple for our family.

HAHbeCg5rNHAeCJiUugSXw.text: First time here, and first time having Ethiopian food. I loved it. Service was very helpful and friendly. I cannot wait to try other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

KkqZOlTh3DzqcaS0i3prrg.text: This is one of Central Avenue's hidden gems! Authentic Ethiopian dishes that are fantastic! I can't emphasize enough how flavorful the food is here!  My recommendation is to go with 2-4 people and order family style for the table.  Get the "Vegetarian Feast" with an order of "Kitfo".  The "beef tips" are good and you should definitely try them at some point but the Kitfo is better in my opinion.  It's minced beef with butter and spices and it's delicious.    Plenty of food for 4 people to share at a great price.  For beer drinkers they have a solid Ethiopian Lager that goes well with the spices.

0PWK6M13A9k0yIIl5UgoBw.text: I went to Abugida Restaurant this afternoon with my son.  He's super into Ethiopian culture right now and was so excited to go.  He did the research (he's 9) and found this restaurant online.  We were both asking the question...who is a full 5 stars with this many reviews?  It's got to be bogus.   It is NOT bogus!  Great food!  Excellent service!  Good times!  We highly recommend this restaurant, even for those like us who were first time Ethiopian cuisine eaters.  The waiter took the time to explain anything we asked him questions about. Enjoy!!!

UOEMMEzfNGeOJrnwFP0b-Q.text: Came here tonight with friends! All of our first times having Ethiopian, and oh my goodness it did not disappoint! We split the Abugida Feast (veggie platter with choice of meat), the Veggie platter, Shiro Wat (lentil dish), and another lentil dish that I'm afraid I can't remember the name of. (Tons of vegan options for my fellow veggies!)   Everything was explained so well, the service was great! And the food was incredible-- fresh and flavorful. Absolutely everything we had was delicious, especially the curry chicken, and shiro wat.   Already can't wait to come back again with more people!

wIInG8buwBgKnX31sMAoQA.text: The food and super friendly service earn this a five star rating. The wonderful smells hot you right as you walk in.   Not fancy, but. Lean, well lite, and great food.

1yL4wsdKBo1D0QGvw1t_oA.text: This is my Favorite Ethiopian Restaurant in South East. The atmosphere is very warm and friendly and the food us delicious. I was away for a few months and missed the njeri, beef, cabbage and carrots and everything.  Most of all, when you go to Abugida's Ethiopian Restaurant,  it's like family. Everyone welcomes you with steaming boul of food. Of course, don't forget to order a META Beer ( one of the choice beers of Ethiopia.) Thank you Yodit and Family for a great oasis of food in Charlotte, NC.

ePDg4-UXeUxyiPK4oPhBvg.text: Okay so I Love when I can give a great review and this is one of those times. We drove 2.5 hours from Georgia to Charlotte to try the food at this place. Note we were not disappointed. The staff was super friendly and checked on us just the right amount of times. The location does not look like much on the outside but it is homey, neat and clean on the inside. The food. Where do I start? So, the only recommendation I have is to cook the cabbage and potatoes a little longer but that is truly a preference on my part. I like them both pretty soft. All of the flavors blended wonderfully and the lamb (see pic) was super yummy. I fell in Love with their Doro Alecha- the chicken was so tender and all of the flavors blended wonderfully! I more than recommend this spot if your are in the Charlotte area and looking for some genuinely delicious Ethiopian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

JrMKJFVZfM300IY1clKoeA.text: My first time here and it definitely won't be my last. Our table ordered the Abugida feast with spicy beef tibs (the BEST flavor) and shiro. I can't explain how tasty and delicious EVERYTHING was. Henok waited on us and was exceptional about explaining the food options and overall customer service. Can't wait to come back!

UJrcV9V9pRoEI3KINy0FAg.text: Wow!   This dining experience transported me to a different land.  I left Charlotte and went straight to Ethiopia!  After reading the glowing YELP Reviews, this place became a priority for me.  So much to review.  First the menu and food - extremely different than American fare, based on presentation and FLAVORS.  I had the vegetable plate which was a sampling of many kinds of vegetables.  It was served with a basket of rolled up spongy bread.  Because there are no utensils, the bread is unrolled and used to scoop up the food.  This takes practice and getting used to.  The experience was fascinating, but probably not good for someone trying to avoid bread. I feel confident that utensils would have been available upon request, however my recommendation is to experience Ethiopian food the way that the natives eat it!   The iced tea had strong hints of Cinnamon and ginger and was simply delicious.  The entire meal woke up every taste bud in my mouth.  Atmosphere - very warm colors and artwork that added to the feeling of being in Ethiopia.  There was only one other table of people dining for lunch today and when they left, we had the entire restaurant to ourselves.  It was a pleasant and comfortable space.   Service - impeccable.  The waiter was as hospitable as it gets.  Explained all the menu options and helped us understand the technique for eating the food. His native accent also added to the feeling of being outside of Charlotte.  So, in summation, I loved the experience and so glad that Charlotte has another dining option that is not a boring chain restaurant.  For those reading this review, GO CHECK OUT THIS PLACE!  Three thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

QWoPoQHKLms80d3NF0v5FA.text: Had the Abugida Feast with doro wat and teff Injera (gluten-free).....AMAZING! Henok gave us wonderful customer service. Very homey atmosphere. I had such a lovely experience

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Abugida Feast

JGJBSjDN2yefZnGc145DTA.text: D E L I C I O U S ! Came here for lunch with my love and crime start to finish, great experience.  The staff are all so friendly and helpful (it was my love's first time enjoying Ethiopian cuisine and our waiter recommended a beef dish that he loved)!  I ordered the veggie feast and it was on point.  The portions are overwhelmingly wonderful, plenty of food for leftovers.  The atmosphere is very home-like, looks and feels like a house. We will definitely return!

2izRdL-MGjZ2_DUaDopyyg.text: The good is incredibly delicious, the service great, what else do you need. I was surprised to find such good Ethiopian food here.

tr_9rsYHxGLv66E6kBG_VA.text: After seeing posts about this place on social media, I decided to venture out and try this hidden gem in Plaza Midwood. To my surprise, this place was very quiet for a Friday night which made for quick and solid service. We tried the sampler platter with beef which was very good and very affordable, however, we'll opt for the vegetarian or chicken platter next time as the beef was a bit tough for my liking. Will definitely come here again.

1Xd_Ah2eUwY-42VmEbyPJA.text: We've had better Ethiopian food in Queens and in Asheville. Last week was our first time. Service and the injera bread were good but that Abugida feast is not worth the money. The best deal is to get the veg entree with 2 sides or share the feast.

tyP-LlaOnZgX_iCguCM-UA.text: Hey guys - I've been here a few times now, but on my last visit (yesterday), I got a very bad case of food poisoning.   The food has always been delicious, and the service superior. But, let's face it - it's not the cleanest place - and that does matter.   And clearly, there is an issue with safe food handling. It's not reasonable that any of the dishes would be "cooked to order", due to the complexity of the preparations. So, the food is made in advance, and then stored in a fridge or freezer.   The owners need to pay VERY CLOSE ATTENTION to how long the food is kept warm, if it sits at low or room temperature, how cold it's kept when stored, and how long it is stored. I have been very sick, and it's just not worth it to me to go back again.   Owners: most people won't tell you - but, they will tell others, and they'll stop going. Good luck getting this sorted out!

4C6Vi4IgC-7iAA-_EG7VnQ.text: Charlotte is so lucky, we have a lot of great Ethiopian restaurants, I truly like every one of them, but Abugida has to be tops on the list.  It covers all the bases. Great service, delicious food at a reasonable price. Parking can be a little dicey, so you might have to park across the street or next door.  If you haven't tried Ethiopian before, fear not, they will help you decipher the menu. Don't miss out on the coffee service if you are a coffee lover.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Be sure to try the Sambusas. Ground beef or vegetarian lentil mixture. Dare I say I prefer the vegetarian?? Trust me!
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

yys3NMQAUO17qWYI5_jc5g.text: Such a great spot! My husband and I went here for an early Sunday supper on a whim and we were not disappointed. We knew we were going to have a great experience the second we walked in because (1) the smell of the food was intoxicating and (2) nearly all of the patrons were Ethiopian (always a great sign of an authentic place).   My husband and I were both very hungry and tend to be big eaters, so we figured we'd start with the house platter with steak. Oh my gosh, so good and so filling! We thought we'd be ordering more food for a second course, but we were stuffed to the gills after splitting this one $18 platter. What a deal!  The service was friendly and the ambiance is very casual, like most places in the area. We will definitely be back. Next time we'd love to try some Ethiopian wine or beer too, and we'll definitely be bringing friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. 5:47pm 16 minutes later. Enough said.
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. 5:31 pm Abugida Feast with ZelZel Wet

3t6Di5jzoi2V2qjX9G7rwg.text: I came here again for the Yelp International Club event today. They had a buffet with both vegetarian and chicken offerings. Everything was delicious, and it was just $17 for all I could eat (and more). I appreciate their willingness to set up this event for us.

VtL39xVrIpzRYmk1lJp6jA.text: Abugida is definitely my favorite Ethiopian.....granted, it is the only Ethiopian food I have tried! My husband and I finally decided to check out Abugida Sunday around lunch.  Prior to coming here, I had done my research and read the reviews. I knew what to expect in terms of ambiance, lack of utensils, etc. While walking in, there were two things I noticed. 1. The restaurant felt like a home. Like settling in to dinner at Grandma's kind of feel. 2. The aroma while walking in hit you so hard that you knew you were in for a good meal!   I did notice that they have added beer and wine to the menu, which is a nice touch. It also looked like there was Ethiopian beer on the menu. We settled on the Abugida feast with chicken.  The feast came out after about 25-30 minutes (I noticed this wait time was consistent but the place is small so it makes sense) and I immediately figured out this was too much food for my husband and I....we definitely gave it our best effort though and almost finished! Everything was soooooo delicious. Yes, it was messy but it was so good. Candidly, I have no idea what I was eating but it was all fantastic and we just went for it.   Additionally, my husband got the Ethiopian coffee which was super tasty. They brew the coffee in a big ceramic pitcher when you order it.  Overall, delish food. I left crazy full. Absolutely unique experience.

oN8661lWjjopXaP1jEWPSA.text: Delicious food, warm inviting atmosphere and authentic food and coffee - this place is a must visit!   Situated in a renovated house on Central Ave, Abugida is a taste of Africa in Charlotte! Half the table ordered vegetarian platters and the other half the beef tips. Everything is served Ethiopian Style on spongy injeera and is meant to be eaten with your hands. The beef tips were so good, sauteed with onions peppers and tomatoes. I got a side of the collard greens (gomera? Sorry I forgot the Ethiopian name! ) that were excellent.   All the vegetarian options were delicious lentils, potatoes, cabbage and more.   The food was delicious and had a lot of flavor, but I wouldn't call it "spicy".   The African beer was delicious and the Ethiopian coffee was OUTSTANDING. I mean wow. So rich and creamy and presented in a traditional way. I would come just for the coffee    Come here you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef tips and collared greens on injeera

N-qtfF7t-vplgsGq_iSXBQ.text: Abugida Fest was awesome. We got 1 beef and 1 chicken. They  both refresh and very flavor full. The spice was just right. The only thing that could be better is if the string beans and greens could have had more seasoning. The staff was very nice and the chef even came by to make sure everything was okay. I appreciate it the great customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fest
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

4L1g58pZYu9Jr602R_AfVQ.text: It's been a long time since I had Ethiopian Food. This is a cute little Yellow house, they had a Buffet today for 10.00. It had most of the vegetable dishes and a Chicken dish . I had the Cabbage, Carrots , and onions. It said it was suppose to have jalapenos in it but it did not. I also tasted the Red Lentils, they were flavorful. The Injera Bread was fresh. They had homemade cottage cheese. Very nice server. My sister had the Collards and the Yellow Lentils and Red Lentils, she liked the flavor with the Ethiopian spice on them !

arHpkKG0U1VXRDNN_mmYGw.text: Food was delicious and very reasonably priced.  The service was excellent.  I order the vegetarian feast and a hot tea.  Everything was delicious and exceeded my expectations. Surprisingly It was very filling, to the point i could finish it and had to take it home.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian Feast

dA2ECdl-b9AVjtKciz5FrA.text: Absolutely delicious!!! Abugida Cafe is the best Ethiopian restaurant we have ever been to! The Abugida feast for 2 which we ordered was excellent along with the lamb special. The 3 of us left completely stuffed and satisfied. The service was great. Definitely give this place a try. We will be back!

tjEijpMsTtscp2b2CSGA1Q.text: Absolutely delicious food, excellent service and a nice, pleasant atmosphere. We ordered the Vegetarian Feast and it was the perfect amount of food for 2 people. Compared to many Ethiopian restaurants in the area, the atmosphere is nicer than most. It wasn't very busy and thus we were served quickly and efficiently. We definitely enjoyed our meal and will be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian Feast. Perfect for 2 people to share

4cPvfZK0uO5CUf8rj0Lm5g.text: I LOVE this place! The food is delicious and the service is super friendly.   During my most recent visit, I took my sister in for her birthday. It was her first time having Ethiopian. The people who work here we so friendly. They seemed just as excited as my sister, explaining the dishes and cooking styles; they seemed to really take pride in what they were doing.   And they SHOULD take pride, because did I mention that the food is delicious!? The vegetarian feast is my favorite. I've also tried the zelzel wat (I think that's what it's called -- it's the beef) and homemade cottage cheese. All of it very yummy.   The vibe is very cozy, almost like going to a friend's for lunch. I can imagine parking being a hassle if they had a rush of customers but I've never had a problem. That said, delivery from here is just as tasty as dine-in so don't let a little laziness get in the way of enjoying a good meal -- go ahead and have someone deliver it to you ;)  I hope this place does well. Seems like some really great people running it and I so love Ethiopian food! Definitely check it out, whether you are a long time fan of Ethiopian or a first timer, you will be glad you did!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian feast around the edges (this was two orders combine on one plate). The beef and cottage cheese are in the center. Yummmm!!

Wif3qaaPP388LZPV5UNbWQ.text: Man am I so thrilled that this restaurant is just a few miles away from me. I've bed hitting it on the way home from the gym and the take out buffet tastes just as good at home as it does there, although I love the friendliness and warm vibes while dining in. Today I particularly loved the cabbage. CABBAGE you guys! How often does one say that?

lew4NT287U3D0Nf-ZRBvdw.text: I have been craving Ethiopian Food for 3 years.  I miss it- ( From Minnesota).   I had the buffet with the Injera and a side of Berbere. Very good.  Nice place.  Will be back!

4PHMn66qLaw_u4Qsz1y9nQ.text: This is a family owned restaurant. All the family was there when I came in for lunch, and the service was excellent!  This is my first time eating Ethiopian food, so please bear with me.  I ordered the vegetarian feast, which came with 6 different diches. The all tasted good, but they were a little too "mushy". The red lentils were my favorite. Honestly, the food tasted really good. It was spicy, but good spicy. The dishes all come with a side of what looks like a very thin sour pancake, I have mixed feelings about the taste and texture of this "bread".  They did not bring any silverware with my food, so I tried going "local" and eating with my hands. All you do is cut a piece of the bread and use it to grab the other food, but after two bites, I decided to order a fork (they have plastic forks in the back).  Now, the place. It looks kind of sketchy from the outside, but the inside is very clean. It is just and old house that was transformed into a restaurant. I think they still have some rooms there...

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian feast - so many flavors in one plate!

v1bnHFAEJ9TFfb9pyd8Ajw.text: Fantastic and very authentic Ethiopian! Don't forget you eat with your hands :)  What to get: we got the feast for two people  and it was great. The only issue is you may need more meat or protein but likely the ideal route for your first time. The traditional bread is delicious and the spices are just delightful. The iced tea was good too.   Other notes: the family who runs this place is super nice. Our bill was very inexpensive ($30) and they worried they overcharged us.   We will be back!

S2_77q19AeOwXTiD9plNeA.text: I have no idea why it took me so long to review this restaurant. Hands down, FIVE STARS. The experience is so consistent, every time I have gone the food has been fabulous and the service is wonderful. The employees are so friendly and helpful - if this is your first time visiting, mention that and they will help you through the menu.  The Abugida Feast is the way to go for a group of 2 or more. We typically add 1 additional protein to have some options - I highly recommend adding lamb, you can adjust the spice level on this as well. This gives you the opportunity to try many items and trust me, you'll be full.  The injera is so tasty, and it's just a fun, almost therapeutic experience to eat with your hands with a group of friends or family.   I also recommend the coffee service!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Abugida Feast - added lamb

PdVdOsriDz8xZYKCU1WnMA.text: Hands down... absolutely incredible.  Typically, vegetables can be very boring, not at Abugida!  I could even become a vegan the spices and flavors are so incredible.   Spicy or non options opting for the Abugida feast is almost no Brainer so you can get a sampling of each veggie minus the shiro, if you have 2 in your party it's enough to fill you both.    Well worth it, think outside the burger and plain standard meh of everything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

mE4kxkwd2Z9a9st03tjDWA.text: Stepping into this quaint and homey restaurant one begins to feel a treat is in store.  Ethiopia, the Great Horn of Africa with 3 million years of history, surely has perfected cooking with all the spices married together in perfect harmony.  And, so it was with my dinner.  Yelp's International Supper event was held here in April 2019.  A bunch of us gathered for an evening buffet set up for us (vs. ala carte), and I think we wiped them out.  I wanted to grab a chafing dish and lick it clean, but Nikki frowned at my suggestion.  Girls!  The highlight for me, beyond the delectable aroma swirling around my head and the soulful company of friends, was the Beef Tibs and, surprisingly, the rice (it was spiced with whole cloves and cooked perfectly).  Mmmmm.  The menu states the beef is "sauteed in onions, tomato, jalapeno, a touch of rosemary and Ethiopian spice butter."  Well, that's intentionally vague.  Whatever that "spice butter" is I want it, and badly!  My guess is it's a riff on berbere, a spice blend which includes cardamom, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, and all-spice, etc.  Well, it's damn good, a winner in my book.  So, looking to expand your culinary horizon to an ancient culture with its food, hospitality, and character front and center?  Way up on my "Give 'em a whirl" meter.  Tear off a piece of injera bread and swab up your food.  Go here!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. A plate of happiness

2EDUsf-5ln0HQ8vF61KmUQ.text: We came here for the most recent Yelp international supper club.   This was my first time trying Ethiopian food, so I was excited. They typically have a lunch buffet which they did for us for this dinner event.   It was the perfect was to try a new cuisine. I loved being able to try some of everything. Everything was delicious. Some things had a very flavorful heat to them which I loved. As others have said, you don't get utensils, but they will bring them if you ask. I didn't miss them myself.   Everyone there was incredibly friendly and accommodating. It's a pretty small restaurant so we took up most of the seating. There is a small parking lot out back.   I would definitely recommend giving this place a try and sampling a new cuisine if you aren't familiar with Ethiopian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffet sampling

mAB4oV1i3oqRq13Xjxk-JA.text: This month's Yelp International supper club took us to discover Ethiopian cuisine. Abugida is a quaint little space with limited seating and parking. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate us and answer all the questions we had.  We got to try the dinner buffet for $17, which is typically only reserved for lunchtime. This allowed us to sample a bit of everything they have to offer. From the pictures and description, the buffet consisted of items from the Abugida feast. We were brought a potato filled pastry as a side. It all was delicious, with the yellow split peas and the red lentils being my favorites.  This is the third Ethiopian restaurant I have visited and my favorite thus far.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffet

oq1d2Nsz_9YHjFgh0TAFaw.text: WOW.   Not going to lie, I was a 1000% skeptic prior to arriving. Visually, I was just nervous to try the food because it was different from what I was used to. My friend was having her birthday dinner at Abugida, so that prompted me to visit.   Parking was about 10-12 spots. The restaurant is smaller inside with a very homey feel.  Was greeted by our server, Henok, who was amazing. Very patient and knowledgeable! He gave us suggestions for food and everything he recommended was soooo good. We ordered the Abudiga feast, beef tibs, and spicy shiro - OMG! The tibs and shiro were so flavorful, I can still taste the spices on my tongue.   One thing that was culturally different was that you ate all of the food with the injera and your hands. No silverware or plates were provided - it was family style, which I also found to be amazing because it allowed us to really engage.   I am so happy with the experience and can't wait to come back and bring others!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Extra Injera
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Abugida Feast
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

CZUV5-XfoNsPR9tlx9hgZQ.text: The service at Abugida is always superb. Food preparation takes a little time, but isn't such the case for everything of quality?

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb Tibs with Collard Greens
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb Tibs w/ Collards

6N6mVTUN4v85B1t_m0x57A.text: I came here for the first time with Yelp International Supper Club. I've heard all kinds of great things about Ethiopian restaurants and loved the opportunity to try one out. The food was served buffet style which was great because it allowed me to try a little bit of everything they had for us. I heavily enjoyed the authenticity and getting the chance to eat all the food using only the injera! It was definitely messy but when the food is great who cares about a little mess!  Foods that really stood out to me were the lentils, the chickpeas, and the cabbage. They were honestly my favorite thing as of right now. Second to those were the chicken and the potatoes. Supper yummy, seasoned well, and full of flavor! The place isn't too big and spacious but nothing wrong with that if you like that kind of scenery. Try Abugida for some great and authentic Ethiopian food!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

GVZ5zoZ1M8yWooNT9V0_FQ.text: TLDR: The food is traditional Ethiopian cuisine. The servers are able and willing to accommodate your needs and answer any of your questions. The vibe is relaxed and casual. The price is considerably reasonable. I recommend trying a little bit of everything at their buffet--you really can't go wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mitin Shiro Wat
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yemisir Kik Wat
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

LcI6Ztaqk7wsG7G5IHF98A.text: Based on one visit.  Went for lunch and they had a buffet or one could order off the menu.  We went for the buffet at 10.00 per person.  They had two meats (beef, chicken) and about seven vegetarian/vegan offerings.  The chicken was my favorite.  It was tender and flavorful.  My wife liked the lentils.  Enjera was fresh with good flavor.    It is in an older building but it was clean and well lit.  A pleasant atmosphere for lunch.

nBhyvfN1ML85vB-eX1055w.text: First experience enjoying Authentic Ethiopian food!   And I must say what a great place to experience it from. The atmosphere made you feel at home and the buffet style lunch was a bonus and perfect for a first timer! The buffet gives you options to try a lot of different things so you are more in tune with what you really like for your next visit!  Not to mention my favorite thing was using my hand instead of utensils! No judgment zone! Messy finger licking good. The food was very tasty and had just the right amount of spices, I particularly loved the beef, lentils and the cabbage and carrot mix. Already planning my next visit with another few first timers!!! Yummy

BBME-c9UDow468UrDtA1Sw.text: One can eat to heart's content here! Worth all the bucks. I got the Abugida Feast (shared with two others) which was the best spread so far! The injera was super well-made and I'd recommend this place to anyone who's looking to try Ethipion cuisine.  The ambience was perfect and people who served us were really friendly.  Absolutely love this one!

QQXOaJR3OZEv-NVmZy6Ysg.text: This is a great place for your both your first or 50th Ethiopian culinary experience because this place is the real deal. Many people there seemed to really know their stuff and be veterans of Abugida.  It's a funny venue and I think it used to be a house. There is not a lot of seating - they ran out around 7pm on the Saturday that we were there. Service is somewhat slow, so I'd expect waiting would take a while.  We each got our own platter which would maybe be too much for some people but worked for us. I love how vegetarian or vegan-friendly the menu is - there isn't variety in teh sense that there's one veg platter but it does, of course, come with many different dishes on it, so it works.

v10FGlI3guM2q-04uv359w.text: Once you step in and take a deep breath, you can smell that you've made the right decision. I'm not sure of al the spices used in the food, but it comes together beautifully.   The decor is simple but cool, beautiful African portraits hang on the dark peach colored walls. The small dining area is very clean, very very clean which I appreciate.   I really enjoyed the vegetarian platter and don't let the fact that it's a plate of vegetables fool you, you WILL get full. This Ethiopian cuisine reminds me of soul food, just seasoned the way Ethiopians prefer if that makes sense. So it's potatoes, collared greens , lentils, etc . You can eat with your hands or ask for a fork. If you choose hands, you use the Injera to scoop your food. I chose fork this time because I had a manicure with sheer lacquer and the food will temporarily stain your nails if you use your fingers.   When you've tried an entree , try the warm herbal tea they have as well. Amazing spice!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

oQRqcgGk_G_tBU0Y2ViMQw.text: My new favorite restaurant without a doubt. Food is superb and very reasonably priced. The service is also outstanding. We had the vegetarian feast with the lamb special. All of the veggies are good, especially the lentils. The lamb was so flavorful and the curry soaked into the injira wonderfully. I'm already plotting how to get back here ASAP.

jvkta2aLDZJnLuULkNlDxA.text: Been here for the lunch buffet for the first time! Awesome awesome ! Loved the place , it's small and perfect. Choices for the buffet were very good- beef, chicken and various vegan options. Also tried the one small traditional Ethiopian coffee. Will definitely visit again. Highly recommended for a different experience..

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch buffet! Chicken , greens , beans , chickpea, lentils , cabbage, potatoes
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Traditional Ethiopian small coffee

5wmDMvwjFc8iZHodQY9Zyg.text: The food had some really great flavors and the service was phenomenal. The staff was super sweet and accommodating.  Here's what I ordered:  Ethiopian Hot Tea-super delicious. You can tell that the tea consisted of real ingredients such as cinnamon sticks and cloves.   Abugida Feast w/ Doro Wet(chicken)-the flavors were really great. My gripe was with the potatoes and chickpeas which were undercooked. That was a texture that I didn't enjoy, however, the seasoning was on point. The Doro Wet sauce had a little kick of spice that was nice and a ric thick consistency. The chicken itself didn't have much chicken flavor nor much flavor from the sauce. It was as though it was boiled (without seasoning) and then added to the sauce right before serving.  Kitfo-It didn't click in my mind that this was mid- rare MINCED meat and not steak cubes. I was expecting something completely different, but had to check myself once I re-read the item description. It tasted like mid-rare..minced...meat..like the menu says lol. I wasn't ready. There were no strong flavors. In fact I brought it home with the intention of cooking it until it's well done and seasoning it to my liking. I wasn't too fond of this item, but it may be good if cooked until well done.  Rice- I ordered my dishes with rice because I am not a fan of the injera bread, which is the traditional accompaniment. The rice was slamming. It was extra long grain white rice with some nice aromatic action going on. I got some to go.  Ethiopian Coffee-I'm not a coffee person, but wanted to have the experience. The coffee had notes of cocoa and had a bit of a bitter after taste which was, surprisingly, quite nice.  I'll be back again to try some more dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

zSpxxomzPxi6lXZgVG3vsA.text: I'm not sure how I am just getting around to writing this review now. After hearing from multiple friends that we had to go and check this place out, my wife and I stopped in for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. Now I will say this place is tiny. it essentially feels like a converted house and has maybe 8 tables. However, I think that adds to the charm of what turned out to be a very fun meal and experience.  This is an Ethiopian restaraunt. For many around this area (including me) this is something that most people have never tried before. I went in with an open mind and wanted to have a unique experience. Starting with the staff, I was blown away by how friendly everyone was!  It felt like this was more than just a business to them, but also a way to share a slice of their homeland. We settled on the Abugita Feast with chicken and the smell of when it hit the table was awesome. No utensils here, so be ready to use your hands with their bread to transport the food to your mouth. It was honestly fun to interact with our meal this way and the serving size was more food than two people should try to eat - so be sure to bring friends!  Overall they are serving up some awesome food and it is a fun way to have a unique experience and learn a little bit more about what is outside our country.

bSr05IbbnuJpsxmlggllBQ.text: I met friends here for lunch.  Menu was available but the buffet was already set up so we went with that.  It was wonderful.    There was a large platter of injera in rolls (not like a bun, rolled up), a dish of beef, a dish of chicken and half a dozen vegetable choices that were absolutely delicious.    I had 3 pieces of injera and left NOTHING on my plate.  That's a nice thing about eating with injera, you can swab every last scrap up and not miss a morsel.  The building is small and unobtrusive.  I missed it when I drove by the first time.  I think I wouldn't have noticed it if I hadn't been depending on my GPS.  It is SO much worth finding.

NLGdNY0rtgHmaUAeFo_ojw.text: Ate dinner here last night. My first time experiencing Ethiopian food and it was fantastic! Server was special as she was the daughter of the chef and most informative. Highly recommend this cafe.

EjN4ndJauGYz2k6zj_rdkg.text: Great food. Finally some authentic flavors and another cuisine to try.  I had a good experience getting some to go but I would recommend eating there.  Keep an open mind and try stuff and enjoy. I went straight for the most authentic dish but this place is great for vegetarians and vegan's. I love eating with my hands , this is how I grew up eating South Indian food. Familiar flavor and vibes.

pRhfFNHk0BqUnBOy5ZAQug.text: The food is wonderful. Great taste and nice atmosphere. We had the  Doro wet, Beef tibs, and the vegetarian feast. All of it was great!

PVaD75dnCrjYf4LHE8wpeg.text: I love this place. Used to live in Los Angeles, adjacent to little Ethiopia - Abugida is easily on par with the best of the restaurants. I have to admit, I almost always get the same thing - Beef Tibs, wet, medium spicy - but I literally have cravings for it. Like, stop what I am doing, get up and go to the Cafe cravings. Best part, generous servings :)  The family that owns this restaurant is wonderful - genuinely friendly and understandably proud of their great food!

BwOz_glNagOLmhvsHhIJwg.text: Amazing food!! You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu!! The lentils are my favorite but again everything is so very good!! And it's really inexpensive compared to the amount of food you get. A great gastronomic experience!!

nONNGPcbcGDTofR74NdRVg.text: been looking for a great ethiopian spot in charlotte. very very yummy and sweet friendly staff! reasonable prices too

zTQXTwhD5YdIbdK4UMopig.text: This restaurant is fantastic! The first thing that hit me when I walked in was the smell of freshly roasted coffee from their coffee ceremony. The food is amazing, and overall it was just a great experience.

QkJkAi9FQRn4LeTghdlQBw.text: The food was very tasty. We had the beef and the veggie feast--both very good. It appears to be a family-run restaurant and has good service. Will definitely go back!

WqBmsLa6W5KBZ6P6dsliqA.text: Had a fantastic meal here! We ordered the feast (vegetarian with one meat dish) and the shiro wat. I had never tried Ethiopian before and am now a huge fan thanks to Abugida. The waiter was so kind and did a great job advising us on what to order despite his slightly broken English. This place is welcoming, authentic, and flavorful. Give it a try!

en4E7xszCeCxYHOM8BI1Xw.text: One of the best Ethiopian food places I've ever been. Their injera is pretty delicious. Their veg platter has got 6 different gravies and they are all very good.

IYE3XNhPc70LFaG1Nq2qrw.text: This was such an amazing dinner I had with two friends. We split the vegetarian feast, shiro and lamb tins and I can't stop thinking about how delicious it was! The service was great too - friendly and prompt. The atmosphere was homey and inviting. We stayed there for a while enjoying our meal and conversation. We ate more than our fill and left extremely satisfied! I 100% would recommend this cute restaurant if you're in the area.

8l8Ne8hM4EFVAVNvXaTyFQ.text: This place is awesome. Friendly service and delicious food. We got two vegetarian samplers (came on one plate) and it was soooo good. Loved the simple vibe inside. We will definitely be back.

0Ed1hhsEGAoFZFKANzoe7g.text: A generous three stars here. We're usually totally on the same page with Yelp on ratings. Not really sure what Yelpers were thinking rating this five stars though. It's almost like we didn't go to the same restaurant. The food was OK, but nothing to write home about. (BUT, this is our first try at Ethiopian, so maybe to us Ethiopian food in general is just OK). That was the good part. Now for the bad: they offer NO ALCOHOL at this restaurant. What's worse, they charge a $5 corkage fee for bringing your own bottle! This was a Saturday night out! Mama needs her wine. There are also no appetizer or dessert options. Which leads me to my next con: the service was horrible. They were nice, but sooooo slooooow. With nothing to munch on, we were starved by the time they brought out our food (about 30 minutes after ordering). In the end, it was an interesting exotic experience, but we won't be back.

tPqCuQv2qr6C8Di3yXHwqA.text: It was my first time and I had an awesome experience!  The food was amazing I highly recommend the feast but you can not eat it by yourself bring some friends with you.

v9MZsMRQf7D6Y3ekAvmi0g.text: Ate here last night and it was delicious!  We got the vegetarian feast, Kitfo, and Shiro Wat.  Everything was spot on, we've had Ethiopian food before and this was easily some of the best.   All the veggies were fresh and the quality was outstanding.  Our server was great, we really wanted to try the Shiro Wat so she suggested we just order 1 vegetarian feast, the Kitfo, and Shiro Wat instead of two vegetarion feasts.  That was a good idea, we already couldn't finish all the food and ordering two feasts would have been entirely too much!    Don't hesitate, go here, and if you've never had Ethiopian food, this place would be an excellent introduction.  Looking forward to are next visit!

fd3nXeVJLrxe-LPDR2sp_w.text: My husband and I ordered the vegetarian feast and added the beef stew. Everything was so delicious and the service was amazing. They explained everything and made sure to check on us. The Ethiopian coffee at the end was a great finish. Love this addition to plaza midwood, we will be back!

4r-q2fyojy1WTrRAlxSuvg.text: Abugida Feast was fantastic, also got the one vegetable dish that doesn't come with the feast (forgot what it was called). Did NOT forget how it tasted. Whatever that dish is, don't think - order it, it's awesome.

YtIb_Nmr7-wduuuj-2fzhw.text: I am a big fan of mom and pop shops and I absolutely loved this place. The hostess was very personable and made us feel at home. If it's your first time here, you should try the Abugida feast(two can share) it has all the essentials and it's a good value. I had the Doro wet myself which I thought was perfect and do not get me started on the injera, they were so soft I could sleep on them(apparently the mom makes it from scratch).  We were there for a casual Friday lunch and the rest of the group, who were trying Ethiopian cuisine for the first time, loved the food. I'm definitely going back again with my family!

photos.caption: Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. You can see the steam coming from the chicken
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pillowy injera
Photo of Abugida Ethiopian Cafe & Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

4VkYrNZC7VatsnwTCz_OjQ.text: Best food ever. Great service and great price. Felt very much at home in the place. The bread was soft and plentiful. I can't wait to go eat again! So wonderful. We will be regulars for sure! It is also vegan and healthy so dont feel bad eating too much

8MiYkE_2VQvkOQmFZVHfDQ.text: Wow! Never had Ethiopian food before but I can't imagine it being any better than this. We ordered the vegetarian feast and the beef tips to share between my husband and me and it was flavorful, spicy, and overall delicious. This place really exceeded our expectations. Besides the food, the staff was so friendly and charming. They spent time at our table talking to us and explaining the menu. We will be back again and again!

VR6n6bNcHELq3UvSK2PzSg.text: Had the buffet. Everything was fresh and tasty. Even hubby who was reluctant to try the food enjoyed all he ate.

WisvkrDUwC21ToYam0RcCg.text: Fantastic place .. Served authentic food Nd the service was very good. .. I recommend this place for people seeking different cuisines.

iwa8O4i_b4y7WE9yimji6Q.text: Great restaurant! Basic decor but there is some cool artwork and items from Ethiopia. This was my first real experience eating Ethiopian and I liked it. Seems like getting one of the feast platters is the way to go, and share with a friend. The staff is friendly and I also learned a lot about Ethiopian culture. Great experience overall.

wuqfCiC6yJJRET5ZFP41sA.text: Fantastic variety of flavors & textures. This place is a gem! We felt like family, as the staff welcomed us and told us about the history and culture of this delicious food. Coming back very soon!

cU3zSQW9I64r7tuwEae9mw.text: We had such a wonderful meal here last night. Everyone in our group of eight was a beginner so we went 100% with the recommendations. It was amazing; delicious and fun. Eating from a shared plate is a really powerful way to enjoy a meal with people. It's the kind of connection too frequently missing from our fast paced world. I look forward to going back and becoming more familiar with the menu items, everything was delicious and in new ways.

eSULCS3nCOCWOVH5EV09YA.text: I forever heart the vegetarian feast!  My crew fully loves Ethiopian food, and this may be my favorite Ethiopian restaurant of all time.  I just went to a top rated restaurant in D.C., and this was sooo much better.  Wonderful flavors, the right amount of spice, and so fresh! My seven year old asked if we could eat here every day! We will be back. Please bring your friends and share the word--we want this new restaurant to thrive!!

T4sK_JLNlUHT3rhF0r0pfQ.text: Nothing short of 5 stars. Food was excellent, service was very friendly. Went there for my wife's birthday lunch it  was well worth it. We were the first ones for their first ever lunch buffet , food was awesome, good variety. To top it off, they gave cake at the end of the lunch for her birthday - the cake was wonderful! We will definitely come back again!

Kuv0AXEJOwjxRaZN-BRauA.text: Hands down the best Ethiopian in Charlotte! I've been to several Ethiopian restaurants in town, and this one is without a doubt the best! The restaurant is light, open, warm, and inviting! The service is friendly and attentive! You cannot eat here and not feel welcomed and happy. The injera is the freshest I've ever had. The kitfo is my favorite and was seasoned perfectly with just the right level of spiciness. The portions are very generous for the price and you will not leave hungry. If you've never had Ethiopian, step out of your comfort zone and head to Abugida Cafe.

1_nzwuBdTXQjVwbcDFEzIg.text: This restaurant was amazing! It is in an old house, but is so clean on the inside. I've had Ethiopian in a few different states (and DC) here, and in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, and their injera rivals them all! My husband and I split the vegetarian feast and beef tibs and ate until we couldn't anymore. Very authentic and the owner/chef was so nice! We spoke with her and they still get all of their spices from back home. Highly recommend.

4NEnA9lnemjZTlHTuU3kBA.text: Hooray- a terrific Ethiopian restaurant close to my home.  The friendliest owner.  Get either veg or non-veg "feast" for a sampling of food.  The chicken that comes with the non-veg platter is delicious, so is the beef (you can choose one).  The beef has a bit of heat, the chicken dish is child-friendly.   Get the Shiro- a creamy red lentil stew.  It is luxurious.  The non-veg feast plus the shiro is enough for 3-4 people. Good Ethiopian food takes a little time.  Don't wait until you're starving to get there, it will take 15-20 minutes for your food to come out.

-1XC5c8UGSPHnC4OqiteVw.text: As we were seated, I overheard a woman behind us say she'd driven past this place in the morning and could smell what was cooking, and knew all day this was what she wanted to eat, and that's when I knew we'd made the right choice. Abugida is a family operation through and through and like all the best Ethiopian restaurants, has the feeling of being a guest at the family table. From the warm, friendly service to the familiar foods prepared with the personal touch of the chef, it might not be fancy but every bite is comfort and delight! The menu is broad, offering choices for omnivores, vegetarians and vegans alike, and options to please people new to the cuisine as well as those experienced with it. The spouse and I each ordered a vegetarian sampler as well as some shiro wat, which proved to be a smart move because the shiro wat at Abugida is some of the most enjoyable I've tried. All the food was delicious, making the long drive back to Raleigh seem even longer since we'd locked the leftovers in the trunk in order to have some cold for breakfast - definitely an underrated part of the Ethiopian food experience! If you want food that will please the spirit and the palate alike, treat yourself to a seat at the table of Abugida.

bjIQni6T7IPnvTX2fToZpg.text: Outstandingly tasty and friendly service too. We had the Abugida Feast and the Vegetarian Feast at our table which gives you some of about everything. These two dishes were more than enough to make 4 people really full and satisfied. I hope this new restaurant makes it because it is excellent and provides something different than the usual Charlotte fare.

ubw9hvEuBnHbSFl3GOg_YA.text: Love the vegetarian feast and their hot tea! Their njeera isn't too dry which is.. a basic requirement.

lb8_PmjOZEtj5nakdRLPSg.text: Amazing food! And very filling! First place I looked up when I arrived in town for vegan food. They had reasonable prices and very friendly service. Will be back.

qzOyC-Psdct0nWgYLOmWlA.text: I enjoyed this place so much.  Authentic food that's incredibly delicious plus very kind and sweet spirited service.  Go check it out!

tF_MO3BRxqYRG-gSNSyLuw.text: SUCH a hidden gem. I had never had Ethiopian before and now can't get enough. Amazing spices and unique variations of familiar vegetables. Come with an appetite and get the vegetarian or Abugida feast. The owner and staff are are so welcoming and accommodating.
